segments.en: Linked Discourses 12
5. Householders
46. A Certain Brahmin
At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: Atha kho aññataro brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then a certain brahmin went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “Kiṃ nu kho, bho gotama, so karoti so paṭisaṃvedayatī”ti?
segments.en: “Master Gotama, does the person who does the deed experience the result?”

segments.pli: “‘So karoti so paṭisaṃvedayatī’ti kho, brāhmaṇa, ayameko anto”.
segments.en: “‘The person who does the deed experiences the result’: this is one extreme, brahmin.”

segments.pli: “Kiṃ pana, bho gotama, añño karoti, añño paṭisaṃvedayatī”ti?
segments.en: “Then does one person do the deed and another experience the result?”

segments.pli: “‘Añño karoti, añño paṭisaṃvedayatī’ti kho, brāhmaṇa, ayaṃ dutiyo anto.
segments.en: “‘One person does the deed and another experiences the result’: this is the second extreme.

segments.pli: Ete te, brāhmaṇa, ubho ante anupagamma majjhena tathāgato dhammaṃ deseti:
segments.en: Avoiding these two extremes, the Realized One teaches by the middle way:
‘Ignorance is a condition for choices.
Choices are a condition for consciousness. …
That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
When ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, choices cease.
When choices cease …
That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.’”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, so brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he said this, the brahmin said to the Buddha,

segments.pli: “abhikkantaṃ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṃ, bho gotama … pe …
segments.en: “Excellent, Master Gotama! Excellent! …

segments.pli: upāsakaṃ maṃ bhavaṃ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
segments.en: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

suttaplex.blurb: A brahmin asks whether the person who acts is the same or different to the person who receives the result. The Buddha rejects both views as extreme.
